title: Thinking of switching my ISP to iinet or TPG. Do you get a good ping and stable connection?
body: Thinking of switching my ISP to iinet or TPG. Let me know if you get a good ping and stable connection with these guys :)

replies.body:
DO NOT USE IINET

IT IS HORRIBLE

I KNOW FROM EXPERIENCE
Thanks for your feed back. I am with optus at the moment, but their exchange is 3km away. TPG has an exchange that is only 1 km away.

> [{quoted}](name=Ragnar0k,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=KtNaezuh,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-06-28T00:09:43.251+0000)
>
> Thanks for your feed back. I am with optus at the moment, but their exchange is 3km away. TPG has an exchange that is only 1 km away.

I don't think you understand how network infrastructure works, lmao.
I have TPG in Australia. I'm lucky to get around a stable 20 ping. Very rarely lags and if it does it's usually due to someone else downloading stuff on the network.

Hey guys, im connecting to one of the two worst ISP's Australia has to offer, will I get shit ping?


Yes.

TPG is cheap but it's a gamble. While mine is mostly working fine save for a few occasions where it would just refuse to work, however a lot of other people have reported having absolutely crap connections when they're with TPG so there's that too.

Hence why I say it's a gamble.

Not sure about other ISPs but if you're thinking about getting TPG, I just feel the need to at least inform you of that before you buy into it.
